title: Nature of a Quadratic Equation Definition
text: The nature of a quadratic equation is whether the solutions are real of complex numbers, and how many solutions of each type to expect.

title: Discriminant Definition
text: For $${ax}^2+bx+c=0$$, where a, $$b$$, and c are real numbers, the discriminant is the expression under the radical in the quadratic formula: $$b^2-4ac$$.

title: Interpreting Discriminant Values
text: If the discriminant is $$0$$, there is one rational solution (double solution.) If the discriminant is greater than $$0$$, if has two rational values if it is a perfect square, and two irrational values if it is not. If the discriminant is less than $$0$$, it has two complex solutions.

title: Identity of $$b^2$$
text: Using the equation, which is given in the form $${ax}^2+bx+c=0$$, what is $$b^2$$?

title: Identity of 4ac
text: Using the equation, which is given in the form $${ax}^2+bx+c=0$$, what is 4ac?
